description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of MoE to use performance monitoring networks, management and support mechanisms to guarantee positive, culturally relevant, inclusive and gender sensitive learning experiences in schools and develop resilient communities in targeted areas., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2019, boys and girls, especially from rural indigenous communities, will access and complete preschool and primary and will have more opportunities to complete secondary education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of MoE to use performance monitoring networks, management and support mechanisms to guarantee positive, culturally relevant, inclusive and gender sensitive learning experiences in schools and develop resilient communities in targeted areas.

description.narrative:
UNICEF apoyo el derecho de niños y adolescentes indígenas para acceder a educación culturalmente relevante e inclusiva, sensible a la equidad de género y a aprendizajes significativos. El acceso equitativo a una educación segura, inclusiva y de calidad es un desafío que debe analizarse y abordarse de forma coordinada y multisectorial.
Las alternativas educativas para la primera infancia y la secundaria deben diseñarse con la participación de la comunidad y los jóvenes. Los mecanismos para lograr su inserción educativa necesitan alejarse de los esquemas tradicionales y empezar a responder a sus necesidades y las de sus familias. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:03/02/2020
